In waterfalls, the 'run' (also known as the 'runout') is the linear distance the
stream flows from the brink of the waterfall to its
base. Therefore, a steeper waterfall would have a shorter
run, and a less inclined waterfall would have a longer run. As an example,
rapids typically have longer runs, as their actual drop is usually much shorter
than the distance they flow. Vertical waterfalls, such as Yosemite Falls, have
short runs.
